translated: “On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was making a raft to cross over;
I worshipped the memorial of Yama;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping a memorial.
the name of the one who was looked after was
he was a king who turned the wheel in the seven directions.
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Citakapūjaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā citakapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Citakapūjakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā citakapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽citakapūjaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The Elder Citakapūjaka’s Birth Story, the seventh.
